did.abstract: The records relate to both the Radical Philosophy Association and to its journal Radical Philosophy Review, and contain correspondence, minutes, typescripts, conference materials membership and financial materials, and printed ephemera and other internal documents related to its political activism, including within the American Philosophical Association.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1982, the Radical Philosophy Association is an international organization whose members struggle against capitalism, racism, sexism, homophobia, disability discrimination, environmental ruin, and all other forms of domination, drawing upon a variety of radical traditions including phenomenology, Marxism, anarchism, post-structuralism, post-colonial theory and environmentalism. Its efforts center on conferences and publications. The RPA also publishes the journal Radical Philosophy Review.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: In 2014, the archived website was added as a series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records relate to both the Radical Philosophy Association and to its journal Radical Philosophy Review, and contain correspondence, minutes, typescripts, conference materials membership and financial materials, and printed ephemera and other internal documents related to its political activism, including within the American Philosophical Association.

appraisal.head: Appraisal note
appraisal.p: Select financial documents, mostly from conference registration, were appraised and destroyed, based on the presence of sensitive personal information and a relative lack of evidential, intrinsic, or informational value.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any copyright held by the Radical Philosophy Association, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in February 2009. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The Alternative Press Center held these records until 2009 when it donated them to the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives. The Radical Philosophy Association allowed the Tamiment Library/Wagner Labor Archives to take possession of these items in 2009 and sent additional materials in 2010. The associated accession numbers are 1950.284, 2010.020, and 2011.103. A poster for the 9th Biennial Conference was donated in 2010 and found in repository; its associated accession number is 2014.084.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs and slides were separated from this collection and established as the Radical Philosophy Association Photographs and Slides (PHOTOS 272).
